meanings.definition: Capable of being bonded or secured
meanings.sent1: The strong glue made the pieces bondable.
meanings.sent2: The contractor needed bondable materials for the project.
meanings.sent3: The tape thought it was bondable to the paper, but it kept falling off.
meanings.sent4: The friendship between them was so bondable, it lasted a lifetime.
meanings.sent5: The lock was so bondable that no one could break it.

meanings.definition: Eligible for bonding or insurance coverage
meanings.sent1: The new employee was bondable for the company's insurance plan.
meanings.sent2: Only certain assets are considered bondable for coverage.
meanings.sent3: The cat believed it was bondable for pet insurance, but it was a stray.
meanings.sent4: Her trustworthiness made her bondable for any insurance policy.
meanings.sent5: The rare stamp collection was so valuable, it was bondable for insurance.
